posts.post_content: TheRedWolf, [Unbender Tine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unbender Tine) costs 4 mana in two colors. That makes it completely unusable in the fast, powerful Vintage decks that use Time Vault. In Vintage, by the time you have four mana, you have almost certainly either won or lost. Costing just one mana, [Voltaic Key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voltaic Key) is much, much faster.

posts.post_content:
@ Dr.Pingas I think it would work quite well with shroud, but now we have Unwinding Clock :/   
  
there's no way to reprint this for two mana to make it un-broken. There will always be made a key to brake it.  
  
Time Vault 2CMC  
Artifact  
Time Vault enters the battlefield tapped.  
You may choose not to untap Time Vault during your untap step.  
If Time Vault becomes untapped, skip your next turn.  
t: Take an extra turn after this one.  
  
It doesn't combo with anything I can think of right now, not even Amulet of Vigor. You would have to Stiffle it, or build your deck around loosing a turn or two.

Posted By: ParaDox420 (2/5/2011 10:37:44 AM)

posts.post_content:
They should just make a ruletext errata and be done with it.
  
   
Time Vault enters the battlefield tapped.
  
![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol): You take an extra turn after this one.
  
If Time Vault would become untapped, you may skip your next turn. If you don't, Time Vault remains tapped.
  
   
So you won't be doing anything funny with it cheaply (replacement effect can't be responded). It can still be exploited by copying the activated effect. Infinite turns is still possible with [Myr Welder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Welder). As far as there are so many 2 cards kill combo in vintage this may be considered acceptable. There are far more ridiculous two-card combo such as [Painter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter)+[Grindstone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grindstone) or [Stuffy Doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stuffy Doll)+[Guilty Conscience](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guilty Conscience) that would kill you for 6 mana (\*cough\* [Mishra's Workshop](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mishra's Workshop)+[Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) \*cough\*).
posts.html:
They should just make a ruletext errata and be done with it.

Time Vault enters the battlefield tapped.
: You take an extra turn after this one.
If Time Vault would become untapped, you may skip your next turn. If you don't, Time Vault remains tapped.

So you won't be doing anything funny with it cheaply (replacement effect can't be responded). It can still be exploited by copying the activated effect. Infinite turns is still possible with Myr Welder. As far as there are so many 2 cards kill combo in vintage this may be considered acceptable. There are far more ridiculous two-card combo such as Painter+Grindstone or Stuffy Doll+Guilty Conscience that would kill you for 6 mana (*cough* Mishra's Workshop+Black Lotus *cough*).

Posted By: non1337 (10/26/2011 1:35:00 AM)
Rating:

@non1337 : They actually errataed it once before to make it non-broken (for a while, it used Time counters, so untapping it couldn't cheat it.)

They decided to switch it back because nowadays errata are only supposed to make a card work as it originally worked, not to change its functionality.

(Hmm, even when it first came out, long before Voltaic Key, you could break it with Animate Artifact and Instill Energy. That was a more complex combo and opened it to creature removal, though, so it was probably considered acceptable.)

Posted By: hellomynameisnoah (8/7/2013 4:46:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Honestly, I think the Oracle text broke this card more than anything. They basically completely removed the condition that any sort of untapping forces you to skip a turn. In the original wording, "To untap it, you must skip a turn", it means you would have to skip a turn even if you used [Voltaic Key](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voltaic Key) or [Twiddle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twiddle)... The Oracle revision to the text seems to have completely misunderstood the mechanic and broken the card by trying to get fancy with the wording.  
  
That all said, somebody else was right when they said [Myr Welder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myr Welder) would still break this card, giving you infinite turns.
posts.html:
Honestly, I think the Oracle text broke this card more than anything. They basically completely removed the condition that any sort of untapping forces you to skip a turn. In the original wording, "To untap it, you must skip a turn", it means you would have to skip a turn even if you used Voltaic Key or Twiddle... The Oracle revision to the text seems to have completely misunderstood the mechanic and broken the card by trying to get fancy with the wording.

That all said, somebody else was right when they said Myr Welder would still break this card, giving you infinite turns.
